title: @Riot, Current state of Vladimir,  what he is, what he should be
body:
[](https://hydra-media.cursecdn.com/dota2.gamepedia.com/3/39/Invoker.png?version=dbbf040b4d8aca2ebf559a4875e9f616)
https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4t_3pr9GEks/V_xNTw_So9I/AAAAAAAAV5w/ymKIp80HdM0fhZwVdjnFcs5hn9ITX2H4wCLcB/s1600/Vladimir_Splash_2_old.jpg

Vladimir is one of those children that are precious to me due to how unique they are and how impossible it is to find a similar gameplay in other characters/games

Recently he received major buffs and it made me willing to play him in ranked then in normals,

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyUktDRD-Fc
 and it was a succes, i saw today a lot of threads about vladimir. I also had a high elo vladimir main telling me that vladimir was killed by riot but balance wise he's fine at the moment
Vladimir has 47% win rate midlane, and 48% win rate toplane and it's GOOD for vlad. Going MR penetration quints+red, then building AP makes him a monster. IMO {{item:3065}}  shouldn't be built anymore, vladimir can't afford to build pure tank items, Once you build AP+CDR on him you will see a very noticeable difference

but This thread is not only about how he is right now, but also about what should happen to make him perfect
First as an other vladimir main told me, he has some annoying bugs going on. I didn't realise it but his W makes him unable to do anything for a few time while his enemies can hit him and destroy him during this time. (maybe it's intended=?)

Vladimir is a hypercarry. His damages in late game stand with marksmen and other late game champions, while in early game he is the trashest champion in the game. No other early game can compete with that
His damage is not only low, but he is slow and squishy his healing has been nerfed a lot against minions his E cd is now 13 sec at rank 1. His only way to survive is his W which has 28 sec cd and costs 20% of his HP, and {{summoner:3}} which is going to be nerfed soon

Thing with vladimir is that he needs to have this early game to be balanced, but this makes him quite frustrating to play because allies expect you to be strong in early game for no reasons and it leads them to not play safe against midlane roaming, start fights before you get items and levels ect..
But it's also frustrating because vladimir becomes unplayable against some toplaner/midlaner, literally the majority  of them can kill vlad easily without vlad to be able to do anything

**how can this be fixed?**
Making vladimir able to go botlane {{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}} 

Seriously no one thought about this? Vladimir is like a marksmen in disguise. he is ranged, He has a very strong DPS that can match their DPS, he can't lane alone he just can't, Imagine {{champion:222}} laning against {{champion:58}}  ? it's exactly the same with vlad 
But why can't vladimir go botlane? he's too much XP reliant
Unlike marksmen. **he can't do anything before both his Q and his E are at rank 5** and it's because of his high cooldown on E before investing a lot of points in it
"but rubick, you want to give him an xp passive?" no, i just want him to instead waiting 13 lvls+1 major items +boots , wait like 8 or 9 lvls+2 major items +boots

How? make him maxing E instead of Q first

make Q cd 3 seconds at all ranks
reduce Q damage+heal from rank 1 to 4

Thus vladimir can lane in peace with a support without fearing to lack of lvls
I don't understand why {{champion:82}} was turned to botlane, {{champion:8}} makes much more sense and way easier to do instead of giving him xp passive+drake passive+so much power into spells

but that's just my 4cents

Oh boy, let's make another {{champion:82}} problem {{champion:157}} champion by trying to force interject them into bot lane for no reason.

Sorry, but I love Vlad, I have no interest in playing him bot lane. Nor do I want him ending up overloaded or garbage. He is a top/mid laner and that is fine. His main problem is the damage amp his ult gives makes him very strong in LCS so they nerf him in soloQ. Randomly stuffing him into bot lane... why?

Vlad could potentially work bot lane because he's ranged and doesn't immediately kill something if he gets on them at any given point like Morde was doing.

Also no cheesy dragon ghost. His ult also doesn't turn the enemy ADC into your ADC.

Its a lot less gimmicky and forced than with Morde.

___________

The biggest issue with Vlad bot lane would be his level progression and how to address that in a healthy manner. Should he still solo lane if he's viable bot? Stuff like that.

He has the full right to come into your thread and give feedback.  He doesn't like the idea of Vlad in bot lane.  He would rather play Vlad in a solo lane.  That has everything to do with this thread and is an important point.  Just because a champion could function in a different role doesn't mean they should be stuffed into that role if their playerbase has no interest in it.  It would be like suddenly balancing Yasuo around being a support just because his general kit works for it with some minor changes.

You can't just ignore how a champions playerbase feels about a set of proposed changes.  If anything that is what you should pay the most attention to.

I'm a Vladimir's main and IMO both of them could use a new passive, as well as a new passive for {{champion:27}} . These "Buy one stat to get another stat" end up becoming these really shitty balancing levers. In fact, Vladimir gains the least amount of stats in gold value per level up because of how damn strong his passive is.

His early is not that bad against melee champions without a strong all in. Due to his ranged, cooldown based, and healing based, nature, he absolutely fucks anyone who can't kill him in few trades. Especially with DFT. Every third Q, he's the one zoning you, instead of the other way around. But it never is the other way around unless you can kill him in a single trade, because he can poke with Q's and autos.
heres a twist, vlad support, he goes relic shield and rushes rylais, with the new keystone for the resolve tree he can keep his adc healed up if they continue attacking

I'm a Vladimir one trick (slowly climbing out of Silver right now, but I am unable to play currently) and I know my opinion doesn't matter but Vladimir has the potential to be good early.

Take Magic Pen reds, AP Glyphs and Quints, Armor or scaling health seals, and go for Thunderlord's Decree. Start {{item:1082}} +3{{item:2003}} , and go try to cheese kill the enemy.

Your E+Empowered Q combo has a 2.11 AP ratio, so if you have enough AP you will be chunking enemies for absurd amounts early game.
